column4: Something has been gradually eating up my main disk space the past week, how can I see which processes are writing to the disk atm?
iotop might be a good bet
there's some more advanced tricks you can do if that doesn't work

ok I think I've found the problem with my diskspace being gradually eaten away, it's the ~/.gvfs folder content. When I try to ls or access that folder the shell hangs, is there a way to move .gvfs to another disk or something?
hmm.what do you mean exactly my disckspace being gradually eaten away? does .gfvs grow a lot in size over the weeks? over a couple of minutes?
about 100MB extra a day, and I only have 850MB left
wow, let me check how big mine is
yeah, have you checked what's in that folder?
actually I have a bazillion pdf's and browsers and shells and kate sessions active so I can't logout atm; i've been suspending to ram the past 30 days
yeah, I pulled one of those 30days recently. I just asking you to check what files were in the folder, maybe you can recognize something and see what's going on
i'll muster up the courage to logout and get back to you, thx =)
dude, I was just saying like open nautilus and go the folder, no logout needed
no it seems logout is necessary, both ls and nautilus stalls when trying to access .gvfs
oh wait, haha, there it goes, .gvfs is empty afterall; back to the drawing board
in accessories you have the disk usage analyzer, would this be of any help?

with ls ~/.gvfs it now says: ls: cannot access .gvfs/movies on foreign-pc: Input/output error ---- Ah, I actually have a stalled copy process going from said foreign-pc, one of those that you just cannot seem to kill...
